knowledge: Common cold Common cold The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.  Symptoms include coughing, sore throat, runny nose, sneezing, headache, and fever.  These symptoms usually resolve in 7–10 days, but some can last up to three weeks.  It is the most frequent infectious disease in humans, with the average adult getting two to three colds a year and the average child getting six to eight colds a year.  The common cold is caused by over 200 different viruses, but rhinoviruses are the most common cause. Common cold Common cold

dialog: Hi Medi, can you explain what are infectious diseases exactly?
Certainly. Infectious diseases are caused by pathogens such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites
How do you get these diseases?
You can get these diseases by coming into contact with an infected person, animal, or contaminated surface
What are some examples of infectious diseases?
Infectious diseases include the flu, pneumonia, tuberculosis, and sexually transmitted infections such as chlamydia and gonorrhea
Can these diseases be treated?
Many infectious diseases can be treated with medications such as antibiotics or antivirals, but some require supportive care while your body fights off the infection
